         <div class="css-xt80pu e12qa4dv0">
          <div class="css-acwcvw epjyd6m0">
           <div class="css-vp77d3 epjyd6m1">
            <div class="css-1baulvz">
             <p class="css-16vrk19 e1jsehar1" itemid="" itemprop="author creator" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
              By
              <!-- -->
              <a class="css-1riqqik e1jsehar0" href="https://www.nytimes.com/by/sarah-mervosh">
               <span class="css-1baulvz" itemprop="name">
                Sarah Mervosh
               </span>
              </a>
             </p>
            </div>
           </div>
           <ul class="css-1w5cs23 epjyd6m2">
            <li>
             <time class="css-rs1psd e16638kd0" datetime="2019-01-01">
              Jan. 1, 2019
             </time>
            </li>
            <li class="css-6n7j50">
             <div class="">
              <div aria-label="Social Media Share buttons, Save button, and Comments Panel with current comment count" class="css-d8bdto" data-testid="share-tools" role="toolbar">
               <ul class="css-y8aj3r">
                <li class="css-60hakz">
                 <a aria-label="Share on Facebook" href="https://www.facebook.com/dialog/feed?app_id=9869919170&amp;link=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nytimes.com%2F2019%2F01%2F01%2Fus%2Fpolitics%2Fromney-trump-oped.html&amp;smid=fb-share&amp;name=Mitt%20Romney%20Says%20Trump%20%E2%80%98Has%20Not%20Risen%20to%20the%20Mantle%20of%20the%20Office%E2%80%99&amp;redirect_uri=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2F" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
                  <svg class="css-4brsb6" height="15" viewbox="0 0 7 15" width="7">
                   <path clip-rule="evenodd" d="M4.775 14.163V7.08h1.923l.255-2.441H4.775l.004-1.222c0-.636.06-.977.958-.977H6.94V0H5.016c-2.31 0-3.123 1.184-3.123 3.175V4.64H.453v2.44h1.44v7.083h2.882z" fill="#000" fill-rule="evenodd">
                   </path>
                  </svg>
                 </a>
                </li>
                <li class="css-60hakz">
                 <a aria-label="Share on Twitter" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=https%3A%2F%2Fnyti.ms%2F2RwRCe2&amp;text=Mitt%20Romney%20Says%20Trump%20%E2%80%98Has%20Not%20Risen%20to%20the%20Mantle%20of%20the%20Office%E2%80%99" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
                  <svg class="css-4brsb6" height="10" viewbox="0 0 13 10" width="13">
                   <path clip-rule="evenodd" d="M5.987 2.772l.025.425-.429-.052c-1.562-.2-2.927-.876-4.086-2.011L.93.571.784.987c-.309.927-.111 1.906.533 2.565.343.364.266.416-.327.2-.206-.07-.386-.122-.403-.096-.06.06.146.85.309 1.161.223.434.678.858 1.176 1.11l.42.199-.497.009c-.481 0-.498.008-.447.19.172.564.85 1.162 1.606 1.422l.532.182-.464.277a4.833 4.833 0 0 1-2.3.641c-.387.009-.704.044-.704.07 0 .086 1.047.572 1.657.762 1.828.564 4 .32 5.631-.641 1.159-.685 2.318-2.045 2.859-3.363.292-.702.583-1.984.583-2.6 0-.398.026-.45.507-.927.283-.277.55-.58.6-.667.087-.165.078-.165-.36-.018-.73.26-.832.226-.472-.164.266-.278.584-.78.584-.928 0-.026-.129.018-.275.096a4.79 4.79 0 0 1-.755.294l-.464.148-.42-.286C9.66.467 9.335.293 9.163.24 8.725.12 8.055.137 7.66.276c-1.074.39-1.752 1.395-1.674 2.496z" fill="#000" fill-rule="evenodd">
                   </path>
                  </svg>
                 </a>
                </li>
                <li class="css-60hakz">
                 <a aria-label="Email" href="mailto:?subject=NYTimes.com%3A%20Mitt%20Romney%20Says%20Trump%20%E2%80%98Has%20Not%20Risen%20to%20the%20Mantle%20of%20the%20Office%E2%80%99&amp;body=From%20The%20New%20York%20Times%3A%0A%0AMitt%20Romney%20Says%20Trump%20%E2%80%98Has%20Not%20Risen%20to%20the%20Mantle%20of%20the%20Office%E2%80%99%0A%0AThe%20Utah%20senator-elect%20criticized%20the%20president%20in%20an%20op-ed%20essay%20in%20The%20Washington%20Post%20days%20before%20he%20enters%20Congress%2C%20raising%20speculation%20that%20he%20could%20try%20to%20challenge%20Mr.%20Trump%20in%202020.%0A%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fwww.nytimes.com%2F2019%2F01%2F01%2Fus%2Fpolitics%2Fromney-trump-oped.html" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
                  <svg class="css-4brsb6" height="9" viewbox="0 0 15 9" width="15">
                   <path clip-rule="evenodd" d="M.906 8.418V0L5.64 4.76.906 8.419zm13 0L9.174 4.761 13.906 0v8.418zM7.407 6.539l-1.13-1.137L.907 9h13l-5.37-3.598-1.13 1.137zM1.297 0h12.22l-6.11 5.095L1.297 0z" fill="#000" fill-rule="evenodd">
                   </path>
                  </svg>
                 </a>
                </li>
                <li class="css-60hakz">
                 <div class="css-6n7j50">
                  <button aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="true" aria-label="More sharing options" class="css-16ogagc" data-testid="">
                   <svg class="css-uhuo44" height="13" viewbox="0 0 16 13" width="16">
                    <path clip-rule="evenodd" d="M15.406 5.359L8.978 0v3.215C3.82 3.215.406 8.107.406 12.66 1.653 9.133 4.29 7.517 8.978 7.517v3.2l6.428-5.358z" fill="#000" fill-rule="evenodd">
                    </path>
                   </svg>
                  </button>
                 </div>
                </li>
                <li class="css-60hakz">
                </li>
                <li class="css-l72opv">
                </li>
               </ul>
              </div>
             </div>
            </li>
           </ul>
          </div>
         </div>
        </header>
        <section class="meteredContent css-1i2y565" itemprop="articleBody" name="articleBody">
         <div class="css-1fanzo5 StoryBodyCompanionColumn">
          <div class="css-53u6y8">
           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">
            Mitt Romney, the incoming senator from Utah and former Republican presidential nominee, revived his rivalry with President Trump on Tuesday with
            <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/mitt-romney-the-president-shapes-the-public-character-of-the-nation-trumps-character-falls-short/2019/01/01/37a3c8c2-0d1a-11e9-8938-5898adc28fa2_story.html?utm_term=.de78ea791875" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">
             an op-ed essay in The Washington Post
            </a>
            in which he said Mr. Trump has not risen to the mantle of the office.
           </p>
           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">
            Days before joining a Republican-controlled Senate, and as
            <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2018/12/31/us/politics/presidential-campaigns-2020.html?module=inline" title="">
             the 2020 presidential race begins to take form
            </a>
            , Mr. Romney issued a pointed critique of the presidents character.
           </p>
           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">
            With the nation so divided, resentful and angry, presidential leadership in qualities of character is indispensable, he wrote ahead of his swearing-in on Thursday. And it is in this province where the incumbents shortfall has been most glaring.
           </p>
           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">
            [
            <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/01/02/us/politics/mitt-romney-trump-republicans.html?module=inline" title="">
             <em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">
              After the essay, Mitt Romney faced counterattacks from the presidents allies. Read more here.
             </em>
            </a>
            ]
           </p>
           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">
            The timing and tone of the piece set off widespread speculation online, with some suggesting that Mr. Romney aimed to position himself as the new Jeff Flake, the departing Republican senator from Arizona who publicly tangled with Mr. Trump.
           </p>
          </div>
          <aside class="css-o6xoe7">
          </aside>
         </div>
         <div class="css-1fanzo5 StoryBodyCompanionColumn">
          <div class="css-53u6y8">
           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">
            Question will be, is he a Flake?
            <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1080447092882112512" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">
             Mr. Trump responded on Twitter
            </a>
            on Wednesday morning in his first response to Mr. Romneys essay. I won big, and he didnt. He should be happy for all Republicans. Be a TEAM player &amp; WIN!
           </p>
           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">
            Others asked, was Mr. Romney, a two-time presidential hopeful, signaling he might try to challenge the president in the 2020 Republican primary election?
           </p>
          </div>
          <aside class="css-o6xoe7">
          </aside>
         </div>
         <div class="css-cfo9c3">
         </div>
         <div class="css-cfo9c3">
         </div>
         <div class="css-1fanzo5 StoryBodyCompanionColumn">
          <div class="css-53u6y8">
           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">
            Brad Parscale, the campaign manager for Mr. Trumps 2020 re-election bid, quickly fired back at Mr. Romney, saying
            <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://twitter.com/parscale/status/1080275396858441728" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">
             in a tweet
            </a>
            Tuesday night that Mr. Trump had saved the country while the senator-elect could not.
           </p>
          </div>
          <aside class="css-o6xoe7">
          </aside>
         </div>
         <div class="css-1fanzo5 StoryBodyCompanionColumn">
          <div class="css-53u6y8">
           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">
            Jealousy is a drink best served warm and Romney just proved it, he said. So sad.
           </p>
           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">
            Mr. Romney and Mr. Trump have long had a complicated political relationship.
           </p>
           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">
            Mr. Trump has called Mr. Romney irrelevant and once bragged that he was a more successful businessman. I mean, my net worth is many, many, many times Mitt Romney,
            <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://thecaucus.blogs.nytimes.com/2011/09/26/trump-to-meet-with-romney-in-new-york/" title="">
             he said in 2011
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">
            When Mr. Trump was running for president in 2016, Mr. Romney called him a phony and a fraud. In 2017 he
            <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2017/08/18/us/politics/trump-charlottesville-romney.html?module=inline" title="">
             excoriated
            </a>
            the president after the deadly white supremacist rally in Charlottesville, Va., for causing racists to rejoice and minorities to weep.
           </p>
           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">
            But Mr. Trump backed Mr. Romneys 2012 run for president, an endorsement that the nominee said meant a great deal.
           </p>
          </div>
          <aside class="css-o6xoe7">
          </aside>
         </div>
         <div class="css-79elbk" data-testid="photoviewer-wrapper">
          <div class="css-z3e15g" data-testid="photoviewer-wrapper-hidden">
          </div>
          <div class="css-1a48zt4 ehw59r15" data-testid="photoviewer-children">
           <figure aria-label="media" class="css-jcw7oy e1g7ppur0" itemid="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/01/02/us/02xp-romney1/02xp-romney1-articleLarge.jpg?quality=90&amp;auto=webp" itemprop="associatedMedia" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/ImageObject" role="group">
            <div class="css-1xdhyk6 erfvjey0">
             <span class="css-1ly73wi e1tej78p0">
              Image
             </span>
             <img alt="" class="css-1m50asq" itemid="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/01/02/us/02xp-romney1/02xp-romney1-articleLarge.jpg?quality=75&amp;auto=webp&amp;disable=upscale" itemprop="url" sizes="((min-width: 600px) and (max-width: 1004px)) 84vw, (min-width: 1005px) 60vw, 100vw" src="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/01/02/us/02xp-romney1/02xp-romney1-articleLarge.jpg?quality=75&amp;auto=webp&amp;disable=upscale" srcset="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/01/02/us/02xp-romney1/02xp-romney1-articleLarge.jpg?quality=90&amp;auto=webp 600w,https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/01/02/us/02xp-romney1/02xp-romney1-jumbo.jpg?quality=90&amp;auto=webp 1024w,https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/01/02/us/02xp-romney1/02xp-romney1-superJumbo.jpg?quality=90&amp;auto=webp 2048w"/>
            </div>
            <figcaption class="css-1l44abu e1xdpqjp0" itemprop="caption description">
             <span class="css-8i9d0s e13ogyst0">
              Mr. Romney at the Capitol in November, after he won his race in Utah for the Senate.
             </span>
             <span class="css-vuqh7u e1z0qqy90" itemprop="copyrightHolder">
              <span class="css-1ly73wi e1tej78p0">
               Credit
              </span>
              <span>
               Erin Schaff for The New York Times
              </span>
             </span>
            </figcaption>
           </figure>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="css-1fanzo5 StoryBodyCompanionColumn">
          <div class="css-53u6y8">
           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">
            The two tried to play nice
            <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2016/11/30/us/politics/a-snapshot-captures-the-awkward-courtship-between-trump-and-romney.html?module=inline" title="">
             during an awkward dinner
            </a>
            together in late 2016, when it was thought Mr. Romney could be a candidate for secretary of state in the Trump administration. Last year, Mr. Trump
            <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2018/02/19/us/politics/mitt-romney-trump-endorsement-senate.html?module=inline" title="">
             supported Mr. Romneys campaign
            </a>
            to become Utahs junior senator  and Mr. Romney
            <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://twitter.com/MittRomney/status/965782061503062016" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">
             thanked him
            </a>
            for the endorsement.
           </p>
           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">
            Mr. Romneys criticism at the outset of the new session of Congress was a blunt message to Mr. Trump that one of his most outspoken Republican critics from the 2016 campaign would soon have a high-profile platform in Washington.
           </p>
          </div>
          <aside class="css-o6xoe7">
          </aside>
         </div>
         <div class="css-1fanzo5 StoryBodyCompanionColumn">
          <div class="css-53u6y8">
           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">
            And while Mr. Romney has largely refrained from the sort of blistering attacks he made against Mr. Trump two years ago, the broadside in The Post suggested that Utahs soon-to-be senator might be open to a third presidential campaign.
           </p>
           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">
            Indeed, parts of the essay sounded like the makings of a primary challenge against Mr. Trump from Mr. Romney.
           </p>
           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">
            To reassume our leadership in world politics, we must repair failings in our politics at home, Mr. Romney wrote. That project begins, of course, with the highest office once again acting to inspire and unite us.
           </p>
           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">
            At the outset of the year before his re-election, however, Mr. Trump does not appear vulnerable to an intraparty threat. He remains broadly popular among Republicans and even more so among the partys most engaged voters, those most likely to vote in a primary.
           </p>
           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">
            But the president is also facing sprawling investigations that touch on nearly every aspect of his life and, with Democrats in charge of the House, is about to face a level of congressional scrutiny and oversight he averted in his first two years in office.
           </p>
           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">
            For most of the first two years of Mr. Trumps presidency, Republican lawmakers muted their concerns about him or expressed them privately. But many of them never fully let go of their misgivings about his conduct.
           </p>
           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">
            To that end, Mr. Romneys op-ed essay spoke to an unease many senior Republican officials still have about Mr. Trump, concerns that some lawmakers finally
            <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2018/12/21/us/politics/republicans-trump-shutdown.html?module=inline" title="">
             began publicly voicing
            </a>
            last month after the president abruptly disclosed plans to pull troops from Afghanistan and Syria.
           </p>
          </div>
          <aside class="css-o6xoe7">
          </aside>
         </div>
         <div class="css-1fanzo5 StoryBodyCompanionColumn">
          <div class="css-53u6y8">
           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">
            Mr. Romney, too, was disturbed by the developments of the past month, citing the
            <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2018/12/20/us/politics/afghanistan-troop-withdrawal.html?module=inline" title="">
             troop withdrawal
            </a>
            and the departures of high-level officials like
            <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2018/12/20/us/politics/jim-mattis-defense-secretary-trump.html?module=inline" title="">
             Jim Mattis
            </a>
            , the defense secretary, and
            <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2018/12/08/us/politics/john-kelly-chief-staff-trump.html?module=inline" title="">
             John F. Kelly
            </a>
            , the presidents chief of staff.
           </p>
           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">
            The Trump presidency made a deep descent in December, he wrote.
           </p>
           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">
            While Mr. Romney made clear that Mr. Trump was not my choice for the Republican presidential nomination, he said he would treat Mr. Trump as he would any commander in chief.
           </p>
           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">
            I do not intend to comment on every tweet or fault, he wrote. But I will speak out against significant statements or actions that are divisive, racist, sexist, anti-immigrant, dishonest or destructive to democratic institutions.
           </p>
          </div>
          <aside class="css-o6xoe7">
          </aside>
         </div>
        </section>
        <div class="bottom-of-article">
         <div class="css-1ubp8k9">
         </div>
         <div class="css-1yif149">
          <p>
           Jonathan Martin and Andrew R. Chow contributed reporting.
          </p>
          <p>
           <em>
            Follow Sarah Mervosh on Twitter:
            <a href="http://www.twitter.com/smervosh">
             @smervosh
            </a>
            .
           </em>
          </p>
         </div>
         <div class="css-vdv0al">

          <!-- -->

          <!-- -->
          A
          <!-- -->
          14
          <!-- -->
          of the New York edition
          <!-- -->
          with the headline:
          <!-- -->
          Set to Enter Congress, Romney First Renews  A Rivalry With Trump
          <span>

           </a>
          </span>
         </div>

          </div>

               <path clip-rule="evenodd" d="M5.987 2.772l.025.425-.429-.052c-1.562-.2-2.927-.876-4.086-2.011L.93.571.784.987c-.309.927-.111 1.906.533 2.565.343.364.266.416-.327.2-.206-.07-.386-.122-.403-.096-.06.06.146.85.309 1.161.223.434.678.858 1.176 1.11l.42.199-.497.009c-.481 0-.498.008-.447.19.172.564.85 1.162 1.606 1.422l.532.182-.464.277a4.833 4.833 0 0 1-2.3.641c-.387.009-.704.044-.704.07 0 .086 1.047.572 1.657.762 1.828.564 4 .32 5.631-.641 1.159-.685 2.318-2.045 2.859-3.363.292-.702.583-1.984.583-2.6 0-.398.026-.45.507-.927.283-.277.55-.58.6-.667.087-.165.078-.165-.36-.018-.73.26-.832.226-.472-.164.266-.278.584-.78.584-.928 0-.026-.129.018-.275.096a4.79 4.79 0 0 1-.755.294l-.464.148-.42-.286C9.66.467 9.335.293 9.163.24 8.725.12 8.055.137 7.66.276c-1.074.39-1.752 1.395-1.674 2.496z" fill="#000" fill-rule="evenodd">
               </path>
              </svg>
             </a>
            </li>
            <li class="css-ar1l6a">
             <a aria-label="Email" href="mailto:?subject=NYTimes.com%3A%20Mitt%20Romney%20Says%20Trump%20%E2%80%98Has%20Not%20Risen%20to%20the%20Mantle%20of%20the%20Office%E2%80%99&amp;body=From%20The%20New%20York%20Times%3A%0A%0AMitt%20Romney%20Says%20Trump%20%E2%80%98Has%20Not%20Risen%20to%20the%20Mantle%20of%20the%20Office%E2%80%99%0A%0AThe%20Utah%20senator-elect%20criticized%20the%20president%20in%20an%20op-ed%20essay%20in%20The%20Washington%20Post%20days%20before%20he%20enters%20Congress%2C%20raising%20speculation%20that%20he%20could%20try%20to%20challenge%20Mr.%20Trump%20in%202020.%0A%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fwww.nytimes.com%2F2019%2F01%2F01%2Fus%2Fpolitics%2Fromney-trump-oped.html" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
              <svg class="css-4brsb6" height="9" viewbox="0 0 15 9" width="15">

               </path>
              </svg>
             </a>
            </li>
            <li class="css-ar1l6a">
             <div class="css-6n7j50">
              <button aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="true" aria-label="More sharing options" class="css-16ogagc" data-testid="">
               <svg class="css-uhuo44" height="13" viewbox="0 0 16 13" width="16">
                <path clip-rule="evenodd" d="M15.406 5.359L8.978 0v3.215C3.82 3.215.406 8.107.406 12.66 1.653 9.133 4.29 7.517 8.978 7.517v3.2l6.428-5.358z" fill="#000" fill-rule="evenodd">

          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="css-12qsqia">
         <header class="css-1k2cc88">
          <h3 class="css-pk3ldd">
           Related Coverage
          </h3>
         </header>
         <div class="css-6su6fj">
          <a class="css-9efuks" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2018/06/10/us/politics/mitt-romney-utah.html?action=click&amp;module=RelatedCoverage&amp;pgtype=Article&amp;region=Footer">
           <div class="css-cmgnk4">
            <div class="css-dg19va">
             <p class="css-zdpruj e6idgb70">
             </p>
             <div class="css-ip4ck2">
              <div>
               <h2 class="css-65zpa8 eoo0vm40">
                Mitt Romney Wants In Again. There Is One Catch.
               </h2>
              </div>
              <time class="css-98gu9q e16638kd0" datetime="2018-06-10">
               June 10, 2018
              </time>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="css-161i88g">
             <figure aria-label="media" class="toneNews" itemid="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2018/05/29/us/politics/29romney-top2/29romney-top2-thumbLarge.jpg" itemprop="associatedMedia" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/ImageObject" role="group">
              <div>
               <span class="css-1dv1kvn">
                Image
               </span>
               <div class="css-zjzyr8">
                <div data-testid="lazyimage-container" style="height:386.6666666666667px">
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <figcaption class="css-17ai7jg emkp2hg0" itemprop="caption description">
              </figcaption>
             </figure>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="css-1i15vd3">
           </div>
          </a>
          <a class="css-ymed4b" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2018/02/19/us/politics/mitt-romney-trump-endorsement-senate.html?action=click&amp;module=RelatedCoverage&amp;pgtype=Article&amp;region=Footer">
           <div class="css-cmgnk4">
            <div class="css-dg19va">
             <p class="css-zdpruj e6idgb70">
             </p>
             <div class="css-ip4ck2">
              <div>
               <h2 class="css-65zpa8 eoo0vm40">
                Trump Endorses Mitt Romneys Run for Utah Senate Seat
               </h2>
              </div>
              <time class="css-98gu9q e16638kd0" datetime="2018-02-19">
               Feb. 19, 2018
              </time>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="css-161i88g">
             <figure aria-label="media" class="toneNews" itemid="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2018/02/20/us/20dc-romney1/20dc-romney1-thumbLarge.jpg" itemprop="associatedMedia" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/ImageObject" role="group">
              <div>
               <span class="css-1dv1kvn">
                Image
               </span>
               <div class="css-zjzyr8">
                <div data-testid="lazyimage-container" style="height:386.6666666666667px">
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <figcaption class="css-17ai7jg emkp2hg0" itemprop="caption description">
              </figcaption>
             </figure>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="css-1i15vd3">
           </div>
          </a>
          <a class="css-ljapoq" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2016/11/30/us/politics/a-snapshot-captures-the-awkward-courtship-between-trump-and-romney.html?action=click&amp;module=RelatedCoverage&amp;pgtype=Article&amp;region=Footer">
           <div class="css-cmgnk4">
            <div class="css-dg19va">
             <p class="css-zdpruj e6idgb70">
             </p>
             <div class="css-ip4ck2">
              <div>
               <h2 class="css-65zpa8 eoo0vm40">
                A Snapshot Captures the Awkward Courtship Between Trump and Romney
               </h2>
              </div>
              <time class="css-98gu9q e16638kd0" datetime="2016-11-30">
               Nov. 30, 2016
              </time>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="css-161i88g">
             <figure aria-label="media" class="toneNews" itemid="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2016/11/30/us/01xp-MITT/01xp-MITT-thumbLarge.jpg" itemprop="associatedMedia" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/ImageObject" role="group">
              <div>
               <span class="css-1dv1kvn">
                Image
               </span>
               <div class="css-zjzyr8">
                <div data-testid="lazyimage-container" style="height:386.6666666666667px">
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <figcaption class="css-17ai7jg emkp2hg0" itemprop="caption description">
              </figcaption>
             </figure>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="css-nn5nd0">
           </div>
          </a>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div>

           </p>

     </main>
     <nav aria-labelledby="site-index-label" class="css-1ropbjl" data-testid="site-index" id="site-index">
      <div class="css-uw59u">
       <header class="css-jxzr5i" data-testid="site-index-header">
        <h2 class="css-vz7hjd" id="site-index-label">
         Site Index
        </h2>
        <a href="/">
         <svg class="css-oylsik" fill="#000" viewbox="0 0 184 25" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
          <path d="M13.8 2.9c0-2-1.9-2.5-3.4-2.5v.3c.9 0 1.6.3 1.6 1 0 .4-.3 1-1.2 1-.7 0-2.2-.4-3.3-.8C6.2 1.4 5 1 4 1 2 1 .6 2.5.6 4.2c0 1.5 1.1 2 1.5 2.2l.1-.2c-.2-.2-.5-.4-.5-1 0-.4.4-1.1 1.4-1.1.9 0 2.1.4 3.7.9 1.4.4 2.9.7 3.7.8v3.1L9 10.2v.1l1.5 1.3v4.3c-.8.5-1.7.6-2.5.6-1.5 0-2.8-.4-3.9-1.6l4.1-2V6l-5 2.2C3.6 6.9 4.7 6 5.8 5.4l-.1-.3c-3 .8-5.7 3.6-5.7 7 0 4 3.3 7 7 7 4 0 6.6-3.2 6.6-6.5h-.2c-.6 1.3-1.5 2.5-2.6 3.1v-4.1l1.6-1.3v-.1l-1.6-1.3V5.8c1.5 0 3-1 3-2.9zm-8.7 11l-1.2.6c-.7-.9-1.1-2.1-1.1-3.8 0-.7 0-1.5.2-2.1l2.1-.9v6.2zm10.6 2.3l-1.3 1 .2.2.6-.5 2.2 2              <a class="css-mzqdl" data-testid="accordion-item-list-link" href="https://thewirecutter.com">
              Wirecutter
             </a>
            </li>
            <li class="css-10t7hia">
             <a class="css-mzqdl" data-testid="accordion-item-list-link" href="http://nytconferences.com/">
              Live Events
             </a>
            </li>

             <a class="css-mzqdl" data-testid="accordion-item-list-link" href="https://www.nytimes.com/section/learning">
              The Learning Network
             </a>
            </li>
            <li class="css-10t7hia">
             <a class="css-mzqdl" data-testid="accordion-item-list-link" href="http://www.nytimes.com/marketing/tools-and-services">
              tools &amp; services
             </a>
            </li>
            <li class="css-10t7hia">
             <a class="css-mzqdl" data-testid="accordion-item-list-link" href="https://www.nytimes.com/events">
              N.Y.C. events guide
             </a>
            </li>
            <li class="css-10t7hia">
             <a class="css-mzqdl" data-testid="accordion-item-list-link" href="https://www.nytimes.com/section/multimedia">
              multimedia
             </a>
            </li>
            <li class="css-10t7hia">
             <a class="css-mzqdl" data-testid="accordion-item-list-link" href="https://www.nytimes.com/section/lens">
              photography
             </a>

             <a class="css-mzqdl" data-testid="accordion-item-list-link" href="https://www.nytimes.com/video">

             </a>

             <a class="css-mzqdl" data-testid="accordion-item-list-link" href="https://www.nytimes.com/newsletters">
              Newsletters
             </a>
            </li>

             <a class="css-mzqdl" data-testid="accordion-item-list-link" href="https://www.nytimes.com/store">
              NYT store
             </a>
            </li>
            <li class="css-10t7hia">
             <a class="css-mzqdl" data-testid="accordion-item-list-link" href="https://www.nytimes.com/times-journeys">
              times journeys
             </a>
            </li>

    if (window.INSTALL_RAVEN) {

    var includeRaven = document.getElementById("RavenInstaller");
    var script = document.createElement("script");
    script.src = "/vi-assets/static-assets/raven.min-830a6d04a55c283934dd1893d6ddc66d.js";
    script.onload = function() {
      /* eslint-disable */
// Install Raven
window.Raven.config('https://7bc8bccf5c254286a99b11c68f6bf4ce@sentry.io/178860', {
  release: vi.env.RELEASE,
  environment: vi.env.ENVIRONMENT,
  ignoreErrors: [/SecurityError: Blocked a frame with origin.*/]
}).install(); // Stop using our error handler

window.nyt_errors.ravenInstalled = true;
var regex = /nyt-a=(.*?)(;|$)/;
var id = regex.exec(document.cookie);

if (id !== null) {
  id = id[1];
} else {
  id = '';
} // Setting nyt-a as user context


window.Raven.setUserContext({
  id: id
}); // Pass collected errors to Raven

window.nyt_errors.list.forEach(function (err) {
  // weird?
  if (!err) {
    return;
  } // also weird ... ?


  if (!err.err) {
    // maybe err itself is an Error?
    if (err instanceof Error) {
      window.Raven.captureException(err, err.data || {});
    } // else { silently ignore? }

  } // just making sure ...


  if (err.err instanceof Error) {
    window.Raven.captureException(err.err, err.data || {});
  } // else { silently ignore? }

}); // Pass collected Tags to Raven

window.nyt_errors.tags.forEach(function (tag) {
  window.Raven.setTagsContext(tag);
});
    };
    includeRaven.appendChild(script);
  });
}

itemprop="cssSelector"/>\n        </span>\n        <header class="css-1n5gntz e12qa4dv1">\n         <div class="css-1hyfx7x" id="sponsor-wrapper">\n          <div class="css-19vbshk" id="sponsor-slug">\n           <p>\n            Supported by\n           </p>\n          </div>\n          <div class="ad sponsor-wrapper" style="text-align:center;height:100%;display:block">\n           <div class="" data-position="sponsor" id="sponsor">\n           </div>\n          </div>\n         </div>\n         <div class="css-1vkm6nb ehdk2mb0">\n          <h1 class="css-1j5ig2m e1h9rw200" id="link-2945a0e2" itemprop="headline">\n           <span>\n            Mitt Romney Says Trump Has Not Risen to the Mantle of the Office\n           </span>\n          </h1>\n         </div>\n         <div class="css-79elbk" data-testid="photoviewer-wrapper">\n          <div class="css-z3e15g" data-testid="photoviewer-wrapper-hidden">\n          </div>\n          <div class="css-1a48zt4 ehw59r15" data-testid="photoviewer-children">\n           <figure aria-label="media" class="sizeMedium layoutHorizontal css-1ox9jel toneNews" itemid="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/01/02/us/02xp-romney2/02xp-romney2-articleLarge.jpg?quality=90&amp;auto=webp" itemprop="associatedMedia" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/ImageObject" role="group">\n            <div class="css-bsn42l">\n             <span class="css-1dv1kvn">\n              Image\n             </span>\n             <img alt="" class="css-11cwn6f" itemid="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/01/02/us/02xp-romney2/02xp-romney2-articleLarge.jpg?quality=75&amp;auto=webp&amp;disable=upscale" itemprop="url" sizes="((min-width: 600px) and (max-width: 1004px)) 84vw, (min-width: 1005px) 60vw, 100vw" src="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/01/02/us/02xp-romney2/02xp-romney2-articleLarge.jpg?quality=75&amp;auto=webp&amp;disable=upscale" srcset="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/01/02/us/02xp-romney2/02xp-romney2-articleLarge.jpg?quality=90&amp;auto=webp 600w,https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/01/02/us/02xp-romney2/02xp-romney2-jumbo.jpg?quality=90&amp;auto=webp 1024w,https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/01/02/us/02xp-romney2/02xp-romney2-superJumbo.jpg?quality=90&amp;auto=webp 2048w"/>\n            </div>\n            <figcaption class="css-17ai7jg emkp2hg0" itemprop="caption description">\n             <span class="css-8i9d0s e13ogyst0">\n              Mitt Romney after meeting with President Trump at the presidents golf club in Bedminster Township, N.J., in 2016. Mr. Romneys op-ed essay on Tuesday raised speculation that he could seek to challenge Mr. Trump in the 2020 primary election, despite the presidents popularity among Republicans.\n             </span>\n             <span class="emkp2hg2 css-1nwzsjy e1z0qqy90" itemprop="copyrightHolder">\n              <span class="css-1ly73wi e1tej78p0">\n               Credit\n              </span>\n              <span>\n               <span class="css-1dv1kvn">\n                Credit\n               </span>\n               <span>\n                Drew Angerer/Getty Images\n               </span>\n              </span>\n             </span>\n            </figcaption>\n           </figure>\n          </div>\n         </div>\n         <div class="css-xt80pu e12qa4dv0">\n          <div class="css-acwcvw epjyd6m0">\n           <div class="css-vp77d3 epjyd6m1">\n            <div class="css-1baulvz">\n             <p class="css-16vrk19 e1jsehar1" itemid="" itemprop="author creator" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">\n              By\n              <!-- -->\n              <a class="css-1riqqik e1jsehar0" href="https://www.nytimes.com/by/sarah-mervosh">\n               <span class="css-1baulvz" itemprop="name">\n                Sarah Mervosh\n               </span>\n              </a>\n             </p>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n           <ul class="css-1w5cs23 epjyd6m2">\n            <li>\n             <time class="css-rs1psd e16638kd0" datetime="2019-01-01">\n              Jan. 1, 2019\n             </time>\n            </li>\n            <li class="css-6n7j50">\n             <div class="">\n              <div aria-label="Social Media Share buttons, Save button, and Comments Panel with current comment count" class="css-d8bdto" data-testid="share-tools" role="toolbar">\n               <ul class="css-y8aj3r">\n                <li class="css-60hakz">\n                 <a aria-label="Share on Facebook" href="https://www.facebook.com/dialog/feed?app_id=9869919170&amp;link=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nytimes.com%2F2019%2F01%2F01%2Fus%2Fpolitics%2Fromney-trump-oped.html&amp;smid=fb-share&amp;name=Mitt%20Romney%20Says%20Trump%20%E2%80%98Has%20Not%20Risen%20to%20the%20Mantle%20of%20the%20Office%E2%80%99&amp;redirect_uri=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2F" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">\n                  <svg class="css-4brsb6" height="15" viewbox="0 0 7 15" width="7">\n                   <path clip-rule="evenodd" d="M4.775 14.163V7.08h1.923l.255-2.441H4.775l.004-1.222c0-.636.06-.977.958-.977H6.94V0H5.016c-2.31 0-3.123 1.184-3.123 3.175V4.64H.453v2.44h1.44v7.083h2.882z" fill="#000" fill-rule="evenodd">\n                   </path>\n                  </svg>\n                 </a>\n                </li>\n                <li class="css-60hakz">\n                 <a aria-label="Share on Twitter" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=https%3A%2F%2Fnyti.ms%2F2RwRCe2&amp;text=Mitt%20Romney%20Says%20Trump%20%E2%80%98Has%20Not%20Risen%20to%20the%20Mantle%20of%20the%20Office%E2%80%99" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">\n                  <svg class="css-4brsb6" height="10" viewbox="0 0 13 10" width="13">\n                   <path clip-rule="evenodd" d="M5.987 2.772l.025.425-.429-.052c-1.562-.2-2.927-.876-4.086-2.011L.93.571.784.987c-.309.927-.111 1.906.533 2.565.343.364.266.416-.327.2-.206-.07-.386-.122-.403-.096-.06.06.146.85.309 1.161.223.434.678.858 1.176 1.11l.42.199-.497.009c-.481 0-.498.008-.447.19.172.564.85 1.162 1.606 1.422l.532.182-.464.277a4.833 4.833 0 0 1-2.3.641c-.387.009-.704.044-.704.07 0 .086 1.047.572 1.657.762 1.828.564 4 .32 5.631-.641 1.159-.685 2.318-2.045 2.859-3.363.292-.702.583-1.984.583-2.6 0-.398.026-.45.507-.927.283-.277.55-.58.6-.667.087-.165.078-.165-.36-.018-.73.26-.832.226-.472-.164.266-.278.584-.78.584-.928 0-.026-.129.018-.275.096a4.79 4.79 0 0 1-.755.294l-.464.148-.42-.286C9.66.467 9.335.293 9.163.24 8.725.12 8.055.137 7.66.276c-1.074.39-1.752 1.395-1.674 2.496z" fill="#000" fill-rule="evenodd">\n                   </path>\n                  </svg>\n                 </a>\n                </li>\n                <li class="css-60hakz">\n                 <a aria-label="Email" href="mailto:?subject=NYTimes.com%3A%20Mitt%20Romney%20Says%20Trump%20%E2%80%98Has%20Not%20Risen%20to%20the%20Mantle%20of%20the%20Office%E2%80%99&amp;body=From%20The%20New%20York%20Times%3A%0A%0AMitt%20Romney%20Says%20Trump%20%E2%80%98Has%20Not%20Risen%20to%20the%20Mantle%20of%20the%20Office%E2%80%99%0A%0AThe%20Utah%20senator-elect%20criticized%20the%20president%20in%20an%20op-ed%20essay%20in%20The%20Washington%20Post%20days%20before%20he%20enters%20Congress%2C%20raising%20speculation%20that%20he%20could%20try%20to%20challenge%20Mr.%20Trump%20in%202020.%0A%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fwww.nytimes.com%2F2019%2F01%2F01%2Fus%2Fpolitics%2Fromney-trump-oped.html" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">\n                  <svg class="css-4brsb6" height="9" viewbox="0 0 15 9" width="15">\n                   <path clip-rule="evenodd" d="M.906 8.418V0L5.64 4.76.906 8.419zm13 0L9.174 4.761 13.906 0v8.418zM7.407 6.539l-1.13-1.137L.907 9h13l-5.37-3.598-1.13 1.137zM1.297 0h12.22l-6.11 5.095L1.297 0z" fill="#000" fill-rule="evenodd">\n                   </path>\n                  </svg>\n                 </a>\n                </li>\n                <li class="css-60hakz">\n                 <div class="css-6n7j50">\n                  <button aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="true" aria-label="More sharing options" class="css-16ogagc" data-testid="">\n                   <svg class="css-uhuo44" height="13" viewbox="0 0 16 13" width="16">\n                    <path clip-rule="evenodd" d="M15.406 5.359L8.978 0v3.215C3.82 3.215.406 8.107.406 12.66 1.653 9.133 4.29 7.517 8.978 7.517v3.2l6.428-5.358z" fill="#000" fill-rule="evenodd">\n                    </path>\n                   </svg>\n                  </button>\n                 </div>\n                </li>\n                <li class="css-60hakz">\n                </li>\n                <li class="css-l72opv">\n                </li>\n               </ul>\n              </div>\n             </div>\n            </li>\n           </ul>\n          </div>\n         </div>\n        </header>\n        <section class="meteredContent css-1i2y565" itemprop="articleBody" name="articleBody">\n         <div class="css-1fanzo5 StoryBodyCompanionColumn">\n          <div class="css-53u6y8">\n           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">\n            Mitt Romney, the incoming senator from Utah and former Republican presidential nominee, revived his rivalry with President Trump on Tuesday with\n            <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/mitt-romney-the-president-shapes-the-public-character-of-the-nation-trumps-character-falls-short/2019/01/01/37a3c8c2-0d1a-11e9-8938-5898adc28fa2_story.html?utm_term=.de78ea791875" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">\n             an op-ed essay in The Washington Post\n            </a>\n            in which he said Mr. Trump has not risen to the mantle of the office.\n           </p>\n           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">\n            Days before joining a Republican-controlled Senate, and as\n            <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2018/12/31/us/politics/presidential-campaigns-2020.html?module=inline" title="">\n             the 2020 presidential race begins to take form\n            </a>\n            , Mr. Romney issued a pointed critique of the presidents character.\n           </p>\n           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">\n            With the nation so divided, resentful and angry, presidential leadership in qualities of character is indispensable, he wrote ahead of his swearing-in on Thursday. And it is in this province where the incumbents shortfall has been most glaring.\n           </p>\n           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">\n            [\n            <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/01/02/us/politics/mitt-romney-trump-republicans.html?module=inline" title="">\n             <em class="css-2fg4z9 e1gzwzxm0">\n              After the essay, Mitt Romney faced counterattacks from the presidents allies. Read more here.\n             </em>\n            </a>\n            ]\n           </p>\n           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">\n            The timing and tone of the piece set off widespread speculation online, with some suggesting that Mr. Romney aimed to position himself as the new Jeff Flake, the departing Republican senator from Arizona who publicly tangled with Mr. Trump.\n           </p>\n          </div>\n          <aside class="css-o6xoe7">\n          </aside>\n         </div>\n         <div class="css-1fanzo5 StoryBodyCompanionColumn">\n          <div class="css-53u6y8">\n           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">\n            Question will be, is he a Flake?\n            <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1080447092882112512" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">\n             Mr. Trump responded on Twitter\n            </a>\n            on Wednesday morning in his first response to Mr. Romneys essay. I won big, and he didnt. He should be happy for all Republicans. Be a TEAM player &amp; WIN!\n           </p>\n           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">\n            Others asked, was Mr. Romney, a two-time presidential hopeful, signaling he might try to challenge the president in the 2020 Republican primary election?\n           </p>\n          </div>\n          <aside class="css-o6xoe7">\n          </aside>\n         </div>\n         <div class="css-cfo9c3">\n         </div>\n         <div class="css-cfo9c3">\n         </div>\n         <div class="css-1fanzo5 StoryBodyCompanionColumn">\n          <div class="css-53u6y8">\n           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">\n            Brad Parscale, the campaign manager for Mr. Trumps 2020 re-election bid, quickly fired back at Mr. Romney, saying\n            <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://twitter.com/parscale/status/1080275396858441728" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">\n             in a tweet\n            </a>\n            Tuesday night that Mr. Trump had saved the country while the senator-elect could not.\n           </p>\n          </div>\n          <aside class="css-o6xoe7">\n          </aside>\n         </div>\n         <div class="css-1fanzo5 StoryBodyCompanionColumn">\n          <div class="css-53u6y8">\n           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">\n            Jealousy is a drink best served warm and Romney just proved it, he said. So sad.\n           </p>\n           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">\n            Mr. Romney and Mr. Trump have long had a complicated political relationship.\n           </p>\n           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">\n            Mr. Trump has called Mr. Romney irrelevant and once bragged that he was a more successful businessman. I mean, my net worth is many, many, many times Mitt Romney,\n            <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://thecaucus.blogs.nytimes.com/2011/09/26/trump-to-meet-with-romney-in-new-york/" title="">\n             he said in 2011\n            </a>\n            .\n           </p>\n           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">\n            When Mr. Trump was running for president in 2016, Mr. Romney called him a phony and a fraud. In 2017 he\n            <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2017/08/18/us/politics/trump-charlottesville-romney.html?module=inline" title="">\n             excoriated\n            </a>\n            the president after the deadly white supremacist rally in Charlottesville, Va., for causing racists to rejoice and minorities to weep.\n           </p>\n           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">\n            But Mr. Trump backed Mr. Romneys 2012 run for president, an endorsement that the nominee said meant a great deal.\n           </p>\n          </div>\n          <aside class="css-o6xoe7">\n          </aside>\n         </div>\n         <div class="css-79elbk" data-testid="photoviewer-wrapper">\n          <div class="css-z3e15g" data-testid="photoviewer-wrapper-hidden">\n          </div>\n          <div class="css-1a48zt4 ehw59r15" data-testid="photoviewer-children">\n           <figure aria-label="media" class="css-jcw7oy e1g7ppur0" itemid="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/01/02/us/02xp-romney1/02xp-romney1-articleLarge.jpg?quality=90&amp;auto=webp" itemprop="associatedMedia" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/ImageObject" role="group">\n            <div class="css-1xdhyk6 erfvjey0">\n             <span class="css-1ly73wi e1tej78p0">\n              Image\n             </span>\n             <img alt="" class="css-1m50asq" itemid="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/01/02/us/02xp-romney1/02xp-romney1-articleLarge.jpg?quality=75&amp;auto=webp&amp;disable=upscale" itemprop="url" sizes="((min-width: 600px) and (max-width: 1004px)) 84vw, (min-width: 1005px) 60vw, 100vw" src="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/01/02/us/02xp-romney1/02xp-romney1-articleLarge.jpg?quality=75&amp;auto=webp&amp;disable=upscale" srcset="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/01/02/us/02xp-romney1/02xp-romney1-articleLarge.jpg?quality=90&amp;auto=webp 600w,https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/01/02/us/02xp-romney1/02xp-romney1-jumbo.jpg?quality=90&amp;auto=webp 1024w,https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/01/02/us/02xp-romney1/02xp-romney1-superJumbo.jpg?quality=90&amp;auto=webp 2048w"/>\n            </div>\n            <figcaption class="css-1l44abu e1xdpqjp0" itemprop="caption description">\n             <span class="css-8i9d0s e13ogyst0">\n              Mr. Romney at the Capitol in November, after he won his race in Utah for the Senate.\n             </span>\n             <span class="css-vuqh7u e1z0qqy90" itemprop="copyrightHolder">\n              <span class="css-1ly73wi e1tej78p0">\n               Credit\n              </span>\n              <span>\n               Erin Schaff for The New York Times\n              </span>\n             </span>\n            </figcaption>\n           </figure>\n          </div>\n         </div>\n         <div class="css-1fanzo5 StoryBodyCompanionColumn">\n          <div class="css-53u6y8">\n           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">\n            The two tried to play nice\n            <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2016/11/30/us/politics/a-snapshot-captures-the-awkward-courtship-between-trump-and-romney.html?module=inline" title="">\n             during an awkward dinner\n            </a>\n            together in late 2016, when it was thought Mr. Romney could be a candidate for secretary of state in the Trump administration. Last year, Mr. Trump\n            <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2018/02/19/us/politics/mitt-romney-trump-endorsement-senate.html?module=inline" title="">\n             supported Mr. Romneys campaign\n            </a>\n            to become Utahs junior senator  and Mr. Romney\n            <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://twitter.com/MittRomney/status/965782061503062016" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="">\n             thanked him\n            </a>\n            for the endorsement.\n           </p>\n           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">\n            Mr. Romneys criticism at the outset of the new session of Congress was a blunt message to Mr. Trump that one of his most outspoken Republican critics from the 2016 campaign would soon have a high-profile platform in Washington.\n           </p>\n          </div>\n          <aside class="css-o6xoe7">\n          </aside>\n         </div>\n         <div class="css-1fanzo5 StoryBodyCompanionColumn">\n          <div class="css-53u6y8">\n           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">\n            And while Mr. Romney has largely refrained from the sort of blistering attacks he made against Mr. Trump two years ago, the broadside in The Post suggested that Utahs soon-to-be senator might be open to a third presidential campaign.\n           </p>\n           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">\n            Indeed, parts of the essay sounded like the makings of a primary challenge against Mr. Trump from Mr. Romney.\n           </p>\n           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">\n            To reassume our leadership in world politics, we must repair failings in our politics at home, Mr. Romney wrote. That project begins, of course, with the highest office once again acting to inspire and unite us.\n           </p>\n           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">\n            At the outset of the year before his re-election, however, Mr. Trump does not appear vulnerable to an intraparty threat. He remains broadly popular among Republicans and even more so among the partys most engaged voters, those most likely to vote in a primary.\n           </p>\n           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">\n            But the president is also facing sprawling investigations that touch on nearly every aspect of his life and, with Democrats in charge of the House, is about to face a level of congressional scrutiny and oversight he averted in his first two years in office.\n           </p>\n           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">\n            For most of the first two years of Mr. Trumps presidency, Republican lawmakers muted their concerns about him or expressed them privately. But many of them never fully let go of their misgivings about his conduct.\n           </p>\n           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">\n            To that end, Mr. Romneys op-ed essay spoke to an unease many senior Republican officials still have about Mr. Trump, concerns that some lawmakers finally\n            <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2018/12/21/us/politics/republicans-trump-shutdown.html?module=inline" title="">\n             began publicly voicing\n            </a>\n            last month after the president abruptly disclosed plans to pull troops from Afghanistan and Syria.\n           </p>\n          </div>\n          <aside class="css-o6xoe7">\n          </aside>\n         </div>\n         <div class="css-1fanzo5 StoryBodyCompanionColumn">\n          <div class="css-53u6y8">\n           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">\n            Mr. Romney, too, was disturbed by the developments of the past month, citing the\n            <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2018/12/20/us/politics/afghanistan-troop-withdrawal.html?module=inline" title="">\n             troop withdrawal\n            </a>\n            and the departures of high-level officials like\n            <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2018/12/20/us/politics/jim-mattis-defense-secretary-trump.html?module=inline" title="">\n             Jim Mattis\n            </a>\n            , the defense secretary, and\n            <a class="css-1g7m0tk" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2018/12/08/us/politics/john-kelly-chief-staff-trump.html?module=inline" title="">\n             John F. Kelly\n            </a>\n            , the presidents chief of staff.\n           </p>\n           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">\n            The Trump presidency made a deep descent in December, he wrote.\n           </p>\n           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">\n            While Mr. Romney made clear that Mr. Trump was not my choice for the Republican presidential nomination, he said he would treat Mr. Trump as he would any commander in chief.\n           </p>\n           <p class="css-1ygdjhk evys1bk0">\n            I do not intend to comment on every tweet or fault, he wrote. But I will speak out against significant statements or actions that are divisive, racist, sexist, anti-immigrant, dishonest or destructive to democratic institutions.\n           </p>\n          </div>\n          <aside class="css-o6xoe7">\n          </aside>\n         </div>\n        </section>\n        <div class="bottom-of-article">\n         <div class="css-1ubp8k9">\n         </div>\n         <div class="css-1yif149">\n          <p>\n           Jonathan Martin and Andrew R. Chow contributed reporting.\n          </p>\n          <p>\n           <em>\n            Follow Sarah Mervosh on Twitter:\n            <a href="http://www.twitter.com/smervosh">\n             @smervosh\n            </a>\n            .\n           </em>\n          </p>\n         </div>\n         <div class="css-vdv0al">\n          A version of this article appears in print on\n          <!-- -->\n          , on Page\n          <!-- -->\n          A\n          <!-- -->\n          14\n          <!-- -->\n          of the New York edition\n          <!-- -->\n          with the headline:\n          <!-- -->\n          Set to Enter Congress, Romney First Renews  A Rivalry With Trump\n          <span>\n           .\n           <a href="http://www.nytreprints.com/">\n            Order Reprints\n           </a>\n           |\n           <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/pages/todayspaper/index.html">\n            Todays Paper\n           </a>\n           |\n           <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/subscriptions/Multiproduct/lp8HYKU.html?campaignId=48JQY">\n            Subscribe\n           </a>\n          </span>\n         </div>\n         <div class="css-i29ckm">\n          <div class="css-1kwfo8p">\n          </div>\n          <div aria-label="Social Media Share buttons, Save button, and Comments Panel with current comment count" class="css-d8bdto" data-testid="share-tools" role="toolbar">\n           <ul class="css-y8aj3r">\n            <li class="css-ar1l6a">\n             <a aria-label="Share on Facebook"         <a class="css-kwpx34" data-testid="site-index-section-list-link" href="https://www.nytimes.com/section/theater">\n             theater\n            </a>\n           </li>\n           <li
